titles: The watch-mans warning-peece, or Parliament souldiers prediction. Shewing, that if our armies lay down arms before the work is at an end, we may expect yet worser harms, more pretious lives and states to spend.
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Verse -  "There vvas a plain, just, dovvnright man indeed,".
Reproductions of the originals in the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
